bestBHT.bht: Be patient and establish your hearts like the farmers do, for the coming of the Lord is near. Living in a state of expectancy, anticipating His speedy coming, can anchor our souls amidst present troubles. Let us be like the farmers, staying firm and unwavering in our faith, enduring all that is laid upon us until the time of deliverance arrives. Possessing patience and enduring trials is an evidence of strength, as we await the blessed hope of the Lord's return.

Henry Alford: Be ye also patient... establish your hearts."
As well as, after the example of, the husbandman.
The coming of the Lord is nigh.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: We are to live in a continued state of expectancy of the Lord's coming, as an event always nigh.
Nothing can more 'stablish the heart' amidst present troubles than the realized expectation of His speedy coming.
Albert Barnes: Be ye also patient - As the farmer is. In due time, as he expects the return of the rain, so you may anticipate deliverance from your trials.

Stablish your hearts - Let your purposes and your faith be firm and unwavering. Do not become weary and fretful; but bear with constancy all that is laid upon you, until the time of your deliverance shall come.

For the coming of the Lord draweth nigh - [...] The most natural interpretation of the passage, and one which will accord well with the time when the Epistle was written, is, that the predicted time of the destruction of Jerusalem [...] was at hand; that there were already indications that that would soon occur; and that there was a prevalent expectation among Christians that that event would be a release from many trials of persecution, and would be followed by the setting up of the Redeemer’s kingdom.
John Calvin: Stablish your hearts...that the Lord was at hand, or that his coming was drawing nigh."
We ought, then, to gather strength that we may become hardened and this cannot be better attained than by hope.
...a realizing view of the near approach of our Lord.
Philip Schaff: Possess your souls in patience; ‘be ye stedfast and immoveable.’ ‘Not the weak, but the strong hearts are qualified to cherish patience’ (Huther).
Endurance is an evidence of strength.

The exhortations of the sacred writers: ‘Let your moderation,’ says St. Paul, ‘be known unto all men; the Lord is at hand’ (Philippians 4:5). ‘The end of all things,’ says St. Peter, ‘is at hand; be ye therefore sober, and watch unto prayer’ (1 Peter 4:7).
Archibald T. Robertson: Ye also, as well as the farmers.
Is at hand. to draw near.
John Gill: Be ye also patient...and in the mean while cheerfully and patiently bear all injuries, and oppressions.
Take heart, be of good cheer, do not be dismayed, or faint, or sink under your pressures, but be of good courage, pluck up your spirits, lift up your heads.
For the coming of the Lord draweth nigh; when he will render tribulation to them that trouble them, free them from all their sorrows and afflictions, and enter them into the joy of their Lord.
John Wesley: Stablish your hearts — In faith and patience.
For the coming of the Lord — To destroy Jerusalem.
Is nigh — And so is his last coming to the eye of a believer.

bhtAttempts.bht: Be patient and establish your hearts, just like the farmer who patiently waits for the rain. The coming of the Lord is near, and we should live in constant expectation of it. There is nothing more comforting and stabilizing for troubled hearts than the anticipation of the Lord's speedy return. So, let us be like the farmers who stay strong and unwavering in their purpose, enduring all trials until the time of deliverance comes. The exhortations of the apostles remind us to possess our souls in patience and be steadfast in our faith, for the Lord is at hand.

Be patient and establish your hearts, just like the farmer who patiently waits for the rain. The coming of the Lord is near, and we should live in constant expectation of it. Nothing can stablish the heart amidst present troubles more than the realization that His return is imminent. So, let us be like the farmers, staying strong and unwavering in our faith, enduring all trials until the time of deliverance comes. The Lord's coming is nigh, bringing release from persecution and the establishment of His kingdom.

Be patient and establish your hearts like the farmers do, for the coming of the Lord is near. Living in a state of expectancy, anticipating His speedy coming, can anchor our souls amidst present troubles. Let us be like the farmers, staying firm and unwavering in our faith, enduring all that is laid upon us until the time of deliverance arrives. Possessing patience and enduring trials is an evidence of strength, as we await the blessed hope of the Lord's return.

Be patient and establish your hearts just as the farmers patiently wait for the rain. With the coming of the Lord being near, we ought to live in constant expectation of His return, finding stability in the knowledge of His imminent arrival. Like the farmers, let us stay strong and unwavering in our faith, enduring all trials until the time of deliverance comes. The exhortations of the apostles remind us to possess patience and steadfastness, for the Lord's coming is at hand.
